alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 3:05AM AKST until January 02 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility will be reduced to one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Yukon Delta Coast. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM Monday to 6 PM AKST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Large drifts could form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A pair of storm systems will approach the area over the next few days. The first system will bring gusty winds, snow and blowing snow Monday evening into Tuesday evening. As the second system approaches Tuesday evening, winds will increase and the visibility may decrease, with blizzard conditions possible Tuesday evening into Thursday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very difficult.
